private_information: I want to meet as many friends as possible during the day
I must allocate at least 90 minutes to meet Robert
traveler.goal: Maximize the number of friend meetings while ensuring a 90 minute meeting with Robert within his availability window

private_information: I will be at North Beach from 16:30 to 21:30
I am available only at North Beach during that window
robert.goal: Be available for a 90 minute meeting with the traveler sometime between 16:30 and 21:30 at North Beach

orchestrator.goal: Combine schedule proposals and availabilities to produce a single PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that maximizes meetings and respects travel times and constraints

public_information: Travel time from Haight-Ashbury to North Beach is 19 minutes
Travel time from North Beach to Haight-Ashbury is 18 minutes
Robert will be at North Beach from 16:30 to 21:30
The meeting with Robert must last at least 90 minutes

generate_schedules.system_prompt: You are the traveler constructing candidate daily schedules. Provide multiple feasible schedules that list time windows for presence at locations, travel moves with durations, and potential meeting slots with friends. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on concrete candidate schedules and durations that respect public information and your private constraints.
generate_schedules.prompt: You are the traveler. Use the public information and your private information to produce alternative schedules for the day. Each schedule should specify arrival and departure times at locations, travel legs with travel durations, and proposed meeting time windows with friends. Ensure at least one schedule includes a contiguous 90 minute meeting with Robert within Robert's availability window.

announce_availability.system_prompt: You are Robert supplying precise availability information and any preferences for meeting times. Provide clear time windows and constraints. Do not emit PDDL.
announce_availability.prompt: You are Robert. State your exact availability window and any constraints or preferences about meeting during that window. Provide discrete time ranges and the location where you will be (North Beach).

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator that must integrate schedule proposals and availability into a single formal planning problem. Produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Model time and durations, include distinct actions for the traveler and for Robert, and include optimization objectives to maximize number of meetings while ensuring a 90 minute meeting with Robert within his availability. If input schedules conflict, resolve them conservatively and document assumptions in comments within the PDDL problem.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Combine the traveler's candidate schedules and Robert's availability to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Keep traveler actions and Robert actions distinct. Represent travel durations between Haight-Ashbury and North Beach and the meeting duration constraint of at least 90 minutes. Provide the domain and problem enclosed in <domain> and <problem> tags respectively. Include comments in the PDDL problem describing any assumptions you made when integrating the inputs.
